subject: Re: [junit] Re: TestUtil: By Example
msgSnippet: ... It s sometimes okay for methods to receive null arguments.  You would need a way to differentiate methods that need a non-null parameter (@NonNull) but
messageBody:
On 2/3/06, Marvin Toll <MarvinToll@...> wrote:
>
>
> This is very interesting - and the scope could go beyond simply
> accessor methods. For instance, the application chronicled
> in "TestUtil: By Example" contains about 5,000 methods (~3,000 are
> accessors). It might be useful to have a list of which of those
> 5,000 signatures, that include a parameter of type Object, do not
> throw an exception for a null argument.


It's sometimes okay for methods to receive null arguments. You would need a
way to differentiate methods that need a non-null parameter (@NonNull) but
even so, the method is probably going to throw an NPE, so where is the added
value?

Don't get me wrong, the idea is interesting, I'm just trying to come up with
the example of a bug that would be faster to find using this method...

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
